definition: to meet
to plan/to seek/scheme
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: I have several friends whose spouses I’ve never met.
sentences.chinese: 有些朋友的配偶我素未谋面。
我明天将来诰日和他谋面。

sentences.english: And then you knew that the girl you met in the street was your long-lost classmate.
sentences.chinese: 你终于意识到，那天碰到的是一位久未谋面的老同学。

sentences.english: I went back to old familiar places, saw friends and family that it has been too long since our last meetings.
sentences.chinese: 我回到那些熟悉的故地，看到久违谋面的家人朋友。

sentences.english: You can form personal relationships with people you would have never met otherwise.
sentences.chinese: 你可以与素未谋面的建立个人关系。

sentences.english: A long time ago, the only things we interacted with that we couldn’t see were ghosts and gods.
sentences.chinese: 曾经，我们能够交流的却素未谋面的只有鬼魂和上帝。

sentences.english: Well, I have a blind date for tonight with a girl named April May.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我和一个叫埃普洛梅的未曾谋面的女孩初次约会。

sentences.english: How could he have stolen from a rival he had never met?
sentences.chinese: 他怎样从一个素未谋面的竞争者手中窃取了机密？

sentences.english: God eight flew away, even if we've never met.
sentences.chinese: 神八飞走了，即使我们素未谋面。

definition: to have never met sb before (idiom); entirely unacquainted/a complete stranger/not to know sb from Adam
to have met once/casual acquaintance
to see each other/to meet in person
to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
strangers coming together by chance (idiom)
familiarity at first sight
to be total strangers (idiom)
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to get to know each other/acquaintance
to meet again after a long period of separation
It is a great honor to meet you.
hasn't yet/hasn't ever
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
a long period of separation
former acquaintance/old friend
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
